title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Leadership tensions are continuing to plague the National Party as Barnaby Joyce refuses to back in Michael McCormack. On Monday, Mr Joyce sidestepped questioning about Mr McCormack's leadership and whether the deputy prime minister had the backing of the Nationals rank and file members. However, Resources and Northern Australia Minister Matt Canavan said the New England MP wasn't being deliberately cagey. "The Nationals have a great team and a great leader in Michael and Bridget. I didn't see Barnaby's interview but often the way these questions get asked they try and place out a trap for people and we've just got to get on with the job. I'm not focused on those things," he told Sky News.
